para: StepErrorScaling subclasses determine how to compute the error estimate when solving a &subproblem; with adaptive time-stepping in . The errorscaling parameter of is a StepErrorScaling object. The adjusts the timestep so that the error estimate returned by the StepErrorScaling object is less than, but not much less than, the given tolerance.
When a time-evolution calculation with adaptive stepping is failing because the step size is too small, it's often due to a poorly chosen error scaling method.
